intro: Bergeranthus caninus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and similar plants. The plant features showy yellow flowers with a distinctive black center, surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its hardy nature and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Bergeranthus caninus is also known for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
